intro: Epipactis helleborine f. przemysliensis, commonly known as the Przemyśl variant of the helleborine orchid, is a rare botanical form native to specific regions of Central Europe. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its greenish-yellow flowers and a distinctive lip that is often marked with purple or brown. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and along stream banks. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and exhibits a complex morphology with a rhizomatous root system. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
